title: Bad Bunny preaches unity, teases what to expect from Super Bowl LX halftime show
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bad Bunny will perform during the halftime show at Super Bowl LX between the Patriots and Seahawks in Santa Clara.
He plans a 13-minute set in Spanish, marking the first non-English primary Super Bowl halftime performance.
NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell supports Bad Bunny, highlighting his ability to unite people through his performance.

title: GOP candidates weigh in on transgender athlete controversy raised on South Shore
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Massachusetts GOP candidates support Pembroke mother's concerns over transgender student-athletes affecting fairness in girls' sports.
Chrissy Nelson claims her daughter lost college recruitment opportunities due to a transgender athlete competing in her sport event.
Critics argue proposed policy changes on athlete participation could create unintended unfair advantages for transgender boys in sports.

title: Mayor Wu announces new efforts to restrict ICE in Boston
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Mayor Wu issues an executive order banning ICE from using Boston city property for immigration enforcement.
Boston police directed to investigate potential crimes by federal agents and prioritize de-escalation tactics during ICE operations.
Several Massachusetts leaders, including Gov. Healey, join Wu to counter ICE actions amid backlash over recent federal raids.

title: Sing your praises for Drake with our Maye-inspired crossword and playlist
author: Peter Chianca and Kelly Chan
bullets: Boston.com offers a Drake Maye-inspired crossword featuring song and album titles with the word 'may.'
A Spotify playlist accompanies the crossword, including tracks mentioned and extra songs for Super Bowl Sunday.
Patriots fans express admiration for quarterback Drake Maye with creative tributes ahead of the Super Bowl.

title: Robert Spillane: Tom Brady’s neutral Super Bowl pick ‘makes me sick’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Tom Brady's neutral Super Bowl LX pick between Patriots and Seahawks upset many former teammates.
Patriots linebacker Robert Spillane expressed disappointment, stating Brady should support the Patriots given his legacy.
Rob Gronkowski voiced support for Patriots, contrasting Brady's neutrality amid his Raiders ownership ties.

title: Lawsuit against Tesla reveals harrowing 911 call as driver trapped in burning car
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Samuel Tremblett, 20, died in a burning Tesla Model Y after electric door handles failed following a crash in Easton, Massachusetts.
Tremblett's mother filed a wrongful death lawsuit against Tesla, seeking $25 million, claiming design flaws lead to her son's death.
Lawsuit highlights 17 incidents since 2016 where Tesla's battery fires and door failures trapped vehicle occupants, calling for regulatory scrutiny.

title: The 6 most romantic places in New England, according to Travel + Leisure
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Travel + Leisure named Boston Public Garden in Massachusetts as one of New England's most romantic places.
Isle au Haut in Maine offers seclusion with under 100 residents, part of Acadia National Park.
Mohegan Bluffs on Block Island, Rhode Island, provide stunning vistas from 200 feet above the ocean.

title: Pickup left dangling off Zakim Bridge in early-morning crash
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: A pickup truck was left dangling off the Zakim Bridge after a crash early Thursday morning.
The driver swerved to avoid a disabled vehicle and ended up stuck on snow and fencing.
I-93 northbound at Exit 19 was closed from just before 7 a.m. and reopened at 8:10 a.m.

title: 2026 Super Bowl commercials: Watch all the ads from the big game
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Ben Affleck directs a 2026 Dunkin' Super Bowl ad featuring Jason Alexander, Jennifer Aniston, and Matt LeBlanc.
AI continues to feature prominently in Super Bowl ads, with Amazon, Oakley Meta, and Ring showcasing smart technologies.
Budweiser celebrates its 150th anniversary with a heartwarming ad featuring a Clydesdale foal and a bald eagle.

title: How much does Tom Brady’s lack of support for the Patriots in Super Bowl LX bother you?
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Tom Brady expressed a neutral stance on the Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl LX, citing no rooting interest.
Brady, now a minority Raiders owner, mentioned supporting individual Patriots coaches but not the team explicitly.
Former teammates like Vince Wilfork criticized Brady's neutral position, urging him to support the Patriots.
